intro: Pasania suishaensis, commonly known as the Suisha pasania, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical with a glossy surface, and it produces pale yellow to white flowers during the spring season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
